title: Daniel Lanois
itunes:title: Daniel Lanois
description:
In 1989, Daniel Lanois was in the upper pantheon of pop producers, having produced globe-shattering albums like U2’s “The Unforgettable Fire” and Peter Gabriel’s “So.” But Lanois was also a songwriter and performer in his own right, and 1989’s solo debut, “Acadie” finally redressed the imbalance.

He joined Deirdre for a short but powerful solo acoustic set in December of that year.
itunes:summary: In 1989, Daniel Lanois was in the upper pantheon of pop producers, having produced globe-shattering albums like U2’s “The Unforgettable Fire” and Peter Gabriel’s “So.” But Lanois was also a songwriter and performer in his own right, and 1989’s solo debut, “Acadie” finally redressed the imbalance. He joined Deirdre for a short but powerful solo acoustic set in December of that year.
media:description: One of the most in-demand producers of the ‘80s, Daniel Lanois returned to his roots for this solo acoustic SNAP set promoting his debut, “Acadie.”
author: webmaster@kcrw.org (KCRW, Tricia Halloran)
itunes:author: KCRW, Tricia Halloran
content:encoded:
In 1989, Daniel Lanois was in the upper pantheon of pop producers, having produced globe-shattering albums like U2’s “The Unforgettable Fire” and Peter Gabriel’s “So.” But Lanois was also a songwriter and performer in his own right, and 1989’s solo debut, “Acadie” finally redressed the imbalance.

He joined Deirdre for a short but powerful solo acoustic set in December of that year.
